title: Ricardo Cordoba needs an icon
content:
Ricardo has been a Typophile user since 2005. He’s in the “Prolific Poster” as one of the top contributors in the past 10 days... yet his icon is the generic, blank T. Design Ricardo an icon and post it in this thread for him.

What do you say Ricardo? If someone posts a good one would you use it?

Same goes for Robert Koritnik, aka _litera_. He’s listed as a top contributor, but he’s only been a member for almost 4 weeks.

Best designs win bragging rights for the week.

REQUIREMENTS:  
60 x 60 pixels  
JPG or GIF

 [‹ Typophile Bugs and Suggestions](http://web.archive.org/web/20070824232417/http:/www.typophile.com/bugs "Go to previous forum topic") [dashes really necessary? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20070824232417/http:/www.typophile.com/node/13893 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Joe Pemberton

Joe, while we’re on the subject of how long I’ve been here on Typophile and have your attention, I’ve actually been here for 3 years and 50 weeks, according to [my earlier profile: ric](http://web.archive.org/web/20070824232417/http:/typophile.com/user/2022)... Is there any way to reunite the two under my current user name? I know a lot of other Typophilers had this problem... Thanks in advance. :-)

Fontplayer and Pearlstreet get my top votes. So does Nick Shinn for sheer humour (that’s right, I spelled it the British way). And Eben’s second one, with the blue background and input from Patty and Hrant — I like that one, too. Typographic Collaboration indeed! :-)

Fontplayer, I think I still have a heavily doodled high school notebook cover onto which I had stuck the RC Cola initials...

Last but not least is Litera... I have thought of using those very two symbols as well, although not exactly like that — now I should make you one! (I’ve also thought of using the **R** and **C** from the New York City subway system)... I am going to try and post some recent sketches for my avatar later in the day, folks... Just so you know that I _have_ been working on an avatar! ;-D

_But hey, don’t kill yourself._

Hrant is right, Eben — I should be the one working on my icon! :-)

Thanks again everybody!
Rock on. Oh, and Ricardo, I can’t edit that info for you. Unfortunately merging your 2 accounts is tricky, requiring database wrangling, and not a simple flip of a switch.

\> Fontplayer and Pearlstreet get my top votes.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20070824232417im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/litera_icon_3_3977.jpg)

I’ve never heard of the director or his films. I guess I need to get out more.

Well, he’s very much indie... Actually he has a new film out, Fay Grim, which is kind of a sequel to an earlier flick, Henry Fool.

But if you want to experience his early and best films, check out [The Unbelievable Truth](http://web.archive.org/web/20070824232417/http:/www.imdb.com/title/tt0100842/), [Trust](http://web.archive.org/web/20070824232417/http:/www.imdb.com/title/tt0103130/), or [Simple Men](http://web.archive.org/web/20070824232417/http:/www.imdb.com/title/tt0105411/).

Factoid: the actress in the pic, Adrienne Shelley was murdered recently by a construction worker. She directed the current film, Waitress. Haven’t seen it.

I blow hot and cold on Hal Hartley, some gems, some turkeys. Great soundtracks tho.
Definitely some turkeys in his oeuvre, Patty. As for his soundtracks, did you know that the composer Ned Rifle is really HH?
As far as I’ve heared word “litera” in Latin means “letter”. That’s why I’ve been using this word for about decade now...
